title.rendered: “Is My Chimney Due For a Cleaning?” Here’s 4 Signs it May Be Time

content.rendered:
So you are wondering whether it’s time to get your chimney cleaned and serviced. A lot of homeowners know that like so many other parts of their home, their chimney should also be regularly cleaned but they often don’t know the right time to hire a “chimney service near me”.

Well, that’s what we are here for! In this post, you will learn the 4 signs that tell you it’s time to sweep your chimney.

You Smell a Strong, Off-Putting Odor

When there’s a problem with the chimney shaft or drafting, it causes strong odors to emanate from the chimney.

Generally, when the fire burns in a well-maintained chimney, it gives off a pleasant smell as you’d expect from burning wood. So if you notice any weird odors coming from your chimney, contact a chimney cleaning near me to correctly identify the source.

The Fire Doesn’t Burn Properly

If you find yourself struggling to keep the fire burning for a few hours, or you can’t start a fire at all, it means your chimney shaft has issues.

When a chimney shaft is clogged with soot or debris, it can prevent air from flowing the way it should. Without proper airflow, it will be extremely difficult to light up a fire and keep it going.

You See Black Soot (Creosote) in the Chimney

If you use your fireplace a lot, you are bound to have creosote formation inside the chimney. Creosote looks like greasy black-ish soot and it develops over a few months. It is highly flammable in nature, so it’s crucial that you clean your chimney regularly, otherwise it can result in a house fire.

To remove the creosote, you’d need to go inside the chimney every 3-6 months, depending on how often you use it, and check the amount of formation. If it looks like there’s a lot of creosote, call in a “chimney service near me” to have it removed.

Creosote is the #1 cause of chimney fires so you need to take it really seriously. To keep your family and home safe from the risk of a fire accident, hire a professional chimney cleaning service right away.

You Hear Bird/Animal Noises in the Chimney

This is obviously a problem because, you know, your chimney should be quiet.

When you don’t use your chimney for a long time, a lot of small animals like rats, birds, squirrels, and other critters can make a home in it.

And that’s not even the worst part; in most cases, these small animals get stuck inside the chimney and die. This can emanate a really bad smell that can stink up your entire house!

So, as soon as you hear any animal noises coming from your chimney, call a chimney cleaning near me service to address this problem.

Call #1 Chimney Service Near Me

At United Home Services, we have been offering chimney cleaning, repair, and replacement services for over 20 years. Our service technicians are adhering to the strict CDC guidelines for handling the COVID-19 pandemic so you’ll be in safe and efficient hands.
